Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain is predicted for the Pakistan-India clash at the 2022 T20 World Cup, with a 90 percent chance of rain and 15 to 30 mm of rainfall expected.
The Australian Bureau of Meteorology has predicted a 90 percent chance of rain on Sunday 23 October 2022.
The match is a sold-out event, with fans from all over the world descending on Melbourne Cricket Ground.
Others: Fans from Pakistan and India are reconsidering their travel plans due to the predicted rain, with some cancelling their trips and others rethinking their itineraries.
The International Cricket Council has scheduled reserve days for the semi-finals and final, but not for other matches.
In case of no play, both teams will be given one point each.
